Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.aem.api

Interface SlingRhyme

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.apache.sling.api.adapter.Adaptable
    public interface SlingRhyme
extends org.apache.sling.api.adapter.Adaptable
    An AEM-specific wrapper for the general Rhyme facade interface.

    It is implemented as a sling model that is initially adapted from the incoming request by the integration's central HalApiServlet and will internally create a single Rhyme instance that will be used for all interaction with the core framework for the duration of the request.

    Your should implement your Rhyme resources as a Sling Model class that adapts from SlingRhyme to your interface annotated with HalApiInterface, e.g.

    @Model(adaptables = SlingRhyme.class, adapters = YourHalApiInterface.class)

    The SlingRhyme instance can be adapted to SlingHttpServletRequest and Resource, but also to any other types (e.g. sling models, or AEM Page) that are adaptable from those types. This allows you to to use the Self annotation to inject any any of those types into your model, and they will be resolved with the context of the resource that is currently being processed.

    This context resource will initially be set to the resource that was originally requested. You can use adaptResource(Resource, Class) to create other sling models for related resources that you want to render with Rhyme. When calling that method, a new (lightweight) SlingRhyme instance will be created that is using the new given resource as a context for resource-based injection (but is still backed by the original Rhyme instance and the incoming request).

    See Also:
    SlingResourceAdapter, AbstractLinkableResource, RhymeResourceRegistration

@NotNull org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource getRequestedResource()

      • adaptResource

        @NotNull
<T> T adaptResource​(org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource resource,
                    Class<T> slingModelClass)
        Creates a new sling model instance for the given resource. Internally this will create a new SlingRhyme instance with the new resource context from which the model class will be adapted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the sling model class
        Parameters:
        resource - from which the model will be adapted
        slingModelClass - that is adaptable from SlingRhyme
        Returns:
        a new sling model instance for which all fields have been initialized
        Throws:
        io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.exceptions.HalApiDeveloperException - if the resource could not be adapted

      • setResponseMaxAge

        void setResponseMaxAge​(Duration duration)
        Limit the maximum time for which the response should be cached by clients and downstream services. Note that calling this method only sets the upper limit: if other upstream resource fetched during the current request indicate a lower max-age value in their header, that lower value will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        duration - the max cache time

      • getRemoteResource

        @NotNull
<T> T getRemoteResource​(String uri,
                        Class<T> halApiInterface)
        Create a dynamic client proxy to load HAL+JSON resources from an upstream service.
        Type Parameters:
        T - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the entry point, in any format that the HalResourceLoader being used can understand
        halApiInterface - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
        Returns:
        a dynamic proxy instance of the provided HalApiInterface that you can use to navigate through the resources of the service

      • getCoreRhyme

        io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.Rhyme getCoreRhyme()
        Provides access to the underlying Rhyme instance of the core framework, just in case you need to call one of the methods for which there doesn't exist a delegate in the SlingRhyme interface
        Returns:
        the single Rhyme instance that is used throughout the incoming request
